Three Thousand Home Animals to be vaccinated In Kogi
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
By Ademu Usman Idakwo
About three Thousand Domestic Animals are to be given vaccines by the officials of State ministry of Agriculture in Lokoja, Kogi State.
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/09/IMG-20220920-WA0013-e1663701771207-300x169.jpg
The programme is in conjunction with the Nigerian Veterinary Medical Association, NVMA on the 2022 Veterinary Week with a tagged ‘ Rabies : One Health- Zero Death .
A Senior Official of the Veterinary department in the Ministry , Dr. Hassana , A said this year free vaccinations for home animals shall commence on September22nd in Lokoja, the state Capital.

She gave further explanation that to commemorate with the World Rabies Day and the 2022 Veterinary week, Two thousand doses of Anti-rabies are to be administered on Dogs and one thousand doses of Pest des petit Ruminant , PPR shall be given to Sheep and Goats, CBPP to cattle and La sota poultry in order to strengthen their health .

The veterinary doctor further stated that there will also be a ‘Mega Dog Walk and Dog Show’ where every pet owners interested in show casing the beauty of his or her dog can enlist it for the exercise which will take place at President Muhammadu Buhari Square in Lokoja, Kogi State Capital.
Dr. Hassana affirmed that kogi state government in the Northern Nigeria has been given adequate care and support to the wellbeing of domestic animals .
The veterinarian said home animals have a yearly routine of vaccinations in the state, stressing that this has reduced the incident of death a raising from disease affecting them .

Wild Animals May Go Into Extinction As Hunters, Farmers Intensify Bush Burning in Nigeria
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
By Ademu Usman Idakwo
Thousands of wild Animals in some parts of Nigeria dies every dry seasons due to bush burning.
Hunters and Farmers in rural communities in Nigeria usually set thick forest which is the natural habitats of wild animals on fire in order to secure a virgin land for farming
The hunters on the other hands take advantage of the situation to attack them in their hide out to kill them and sell them to the locals for consumption.
This development is affecting the living conditions of wild life in the country .
The fire usually kills the young ones in a large numbers since they were not strong enough to escape from the inferno, reducing the size able numbers of wild animals population in Nigeria forest .

A forest officer in a local government council of Dekina in kogi state in the North region of Nigeria , Idris Ahmadu while speaking to Africa Animal Media, AAM said wild animals are going into extinction in the area due to Terrestrial hazard caused by humans against wild life in the forest .
He said the Forest Reserves in the area had been depleted by bush burning , and tree felling which has lead to total destruction of wildlife .
The Forest expert cautioned residents of the local communities to safe the wildlife as they deserves to live like other living things .

Rabies Virus hit Dogs in Rivers State As 5 Dies
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
Not fever than Five dogs have died from Rabies Virus in Okobie Onikwu  community of Rivers State in Southern Nigeria .
An eyewitness accounts reported that the virus broke out following the refusal of some Pet owners in the community to take them to Veterinary Clinic for vaccinations.
He said the government have been making effort to ensure animals are adequately vaccinated to safe them from deadly diseases.
He how ever admitted that the awareness from the government was not enough as some rural dwellers did not know the implication of not vaccinating their pets and other domestic animals.

The Rivers State ministry of Agriculture has therefore been urged to deplore animals disease surveillance team to the community to ascertain the true cause of their death and find a solution to the disaster .
According to Global Alliance for Rabies Control , rabies virus has been  killing humans and animals for 4, 000 years . It is a zoonotic disease transmitted between animals and humans through Saliva .
The reports further said 59, 000 people die from rabies every year , 99% due to an exposure to an infected domestic dog .

Indication has how ever emerged that Nigeria animal care is below the acceptable norms as animal welfare has never been considered for a National budget, this was said to have caused several epidemics out break in  animals than humans in the country .

Animals Facing  Hard Times In Portharcourt Zoo
As Over 50 Allegedly Dies from poor conditions
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

This is not the best of time for Animals staying in the Zoological Park in Portharcourt, Rivers State of Southern Nigeria. The zoo which is located at Trans Amadi in Portharcourt is owned by the State Government.
The Zoo was created in 1974 by the military governor of Rivers State, Alfred Diete-Spifff . The Zoo did not go into operation fully until it was commissioned on the 1st October, 1975.
It was said to had started with Sixty- Seven animals with a breakdown of 37 mammals and 30 non mammals.

As at last count, Africa Animal Media investigation, AAM revealed that the zoo which was hitherto a tourist attraction to the people from south-south due to the present of beautiful and healthy animals such as Birds , Monkeys, Tortoise, Lions , Tigers and Elephants, has become a ghost of itself as most of those animals are dead due to lack of proper feedings and medical cares.
A former worker in the Zoo who begged for anonymity said the zoo only received a second attention in 1999 from the then governor , Peter Odili , 24 years after it was established.

He also disclosed that the zoo had been over grown with weeds making  the animals been attacked by dangerous insects and reptiles that usually leads to illness and eventual death as a result of adequate medical intervention.

The former Animal Keeper added that majority of animals died as a result of starvation and health challenges, stressing that he decided to resign to safe his life following the near death experience he had in an encounter with the only surviving lion in the zoo sometime last year .
“I was nearly devoured by King of the jungle while  attending to it when it was hungry  “ he revealed
He explained that he used to be some how friendly with the lion but was surprised on that fateful day that the lion ran wild.
He though attributed the behavior to hunger and lack of adequate care to the lion , whose present condition like all other animals there can never be imagined.

The deteriorating weather conditions which leads to flood disaster year in , year out in Nigeria has over the weekend claimed lives of domestic animals in Bilachi and Morro villages in Demsa Local government area in Adamawa state , North East- Nigeria .
An eyewitness account disclosed that an estimated figures of eighty to a hundred of animals were swept away by the monster flood into the river in the two neighboring villages of Adamawa State .

He blamed the incidents on the residents of the affected communities for refusing to adhere to warning from the weather forecast organizations, especially Nigerian Hydrological Service Agencies, ( NIHSA) that were issuing alert daily .

The insider said the flood over ran the villages and it surroundings but no human was a casualty except animals who were unfortunately in their  Barns and couldn’t not run to safety because the doors were locked.
He gave the break down of the affected animals which he said to be mostly livestock to include Cow, sheep , goats and Pigs .

The eyes witness account further revealed that other affected animals were companions like dogs, cats and donkeys, he admitted though, that few were rescued by the local divers from another communities but the help came too late as almost 100 animals died in the disaster.
Unconfirmed report on Monday said over six millions people including their domestic animals have been displaced by the flood in Nigeria .

Stop Using Animals For Toxic, VaccinesTest-Medical,Research Institutes Told
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

As the world continues to witness the atrocities being committed against Animals by Medical laboratories ,Scientific and Research Institutions in decades ,a retired veterinary doctor ,Mr. Peter Okolofo has called on laboratories in Nigeria to stop using animals as test for toxic substances and  vaccines .
Dr . Okolofo was speaking on Tuesday against the backdrop of alleged use of ducks and dogs to test on vaccines and medicines by some research institutes in Nigeria .
He said in as much as the life of human being is important ,the life of non humans should be seen as that too, because they were all created by God to serve some purposes .

The Veterinarian turned clergy stated  it is high time the technology should begin to evolve to pave way for new way of testing the effectiveness of newly manufactured drugs and vaccines instead of using the animals .
He condemned the scientists for the continued using of animals for safety testing chemicals in factories ,calling on the federal government to step up action to safe the animals from the cruelty.
He recalled how thousands of ducks were killed in the cause of trying to uncover toxic substances in Zamfara state, Northern Nigeria in 2010 following the out break of lead poisoning in the state .
He equally  noted that human mistakes must not cost animals their lives ,adding that measures should be put in place to safe the lives of non humans in every environment in Nigeria .

Why Plant Based- Meat Is Good For You
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
A recent study conducted by the United States National Institutes of Health discovered that vegan meats were high in folate, iron, fibre and had less saturated fat than animal meats.
In other words, plant-based meat substitutes can lower the risk for heart disease, high blood pressure and obesity .
In a bid to ascertain the level of plant based meat adoption in Nigeria , a  research  was recently carried out by AfricaAnimalMedia, in selected communities in the Northern Nigeria.
5% of Nigerians residing in those surveyed are identified as vegetarians while 95% are still into normal lives of eating animal meats.

The majority of those that falls into this category were the Fulanis tribe, it could be as a result of their nomadic nature that they were  don’t eating animal meats, though that is yet to be ascertained.
How ever , investigations further revealed that some of them eats non mammals like birds and fish but majority are abstained.
The other category of people who spoke to our correspondent said they were exempted  from consuming animals meat on health advice or religious believe.
This group of people were said to be mostly elderly and they looks healthier than some young people that consumes animals meat regularly.
It is estimated that about 13million Fulani people live in Nigeria with  6 % of the country population, even as 95 % of total population of the surveyed Communities are still consuming animals meat.
In Nigeria, a company known as Veggie Victory in 2019 started the production of plant-based meat on a commercial scale .
Its product – Vchunks which worked well in Nigerian dishes where cubes of meat were used like stews is said to be making progress .

Although, the product is manufactured in Lagos state in Nigeria but has extended  its customer’s network to Kenya, Ghana and many others even though it is yet to fully integrated into daily meal by many Nigerians.
Vchunks are found on the shelves of reasonable numbers of supermarkets in Nigeria, Ghana and Kenya .
The Benefits of Eating plant based meats can not be over -emphasized as it helps to provide the body with the following:
– It relieves and prevent constipation.
– Help with weight loss.
–  It increases the body’s level potassium.
–   It helps lower blood sugar.
– Help lower Cholesterol.
As well as improve your sleep .
why Plant- based meat ?
Quite a number of people are becoming aware of enormous problems associated with eating animals meat .
Apart from the negative health issues, the animals in factory farms are severely abused and it is immoral .
Factory farming according to many reports were mostly responsible for climate crisis because of the animal wastes.
Support Plant based meats to eat healthy !

Every one has set a goal of what to achieve in career pursuit and a 12 year old, Chibuike Napoleon, a Zoo attendant in one of Nigerian Zoos is no exception.
In his bid to fulfill his passion for animal welfare,he has declared his intention to study veterinary medicine in the nearest future in order to attend to animals health .

Napoleon whose interviews were monitored by African Animal Media, AAM on the British Broadcasting Services, BBC told the international media out fit  that he joined the work through the mother who is a photographer.
The young Napoleon further  disclosed that he used to follow the mother to the zoo when he was 6 years to take photos of zoo visitors who come to the zoo to see animals.
He said the mother has been zoo photographer from the beginning and that is what she does for a living .
He explained that he started having interest in animals and also loved playing with them when ever he visits the zoo with his mother .
Napoleon claimed that his favorite among the animals was lion and the lion knows him and recognize his voice .
He gave the lion a game and when ever he calls the lion by the name , the lion answers .
On how he started the Job .

The Zoo attendant stated that he began the journey into the career as a volunteer apprentice and his work was to lead tourists around the zoo to show them the animals and also teach them many things about the animals in the zoo .
When management of the zoo saw that he is good at the job, he was allowed to be a volunteer attendant in the zoo.
Napoleon who is the youngest zoo attendant knows the names and the botanical names of all the animals in the zoo.
He said his ambition is to become a veterinary doctor to help the animals in the nearest future.

Farmers and Herders Clash, Time To Re- Visit  Graze Settlements In Nigeria
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

As conflicts between farmers and herders in many parts of Nigeria continue to fester un-abated , there are renew calls by well meaning individuals on the government to again  take a look at establishing a graze reserves for cows across various regions of the country to stem the tide of violence that often leads to death of humans and cows .
The-incessant crisis between sedentary farmers and nomadic Fulani herdsmen have claimed thousands of humans and cow’s lives since 2018 that the unrest escalated into open fights .

According to those interviewed by our correspondent, it was suggested that graze reserves will restrict the movement of cows into the farms were people are growing crops, there by reducing the conflicts resulting from cow destroying the crops .

Though the federal government had come up with such plans in the past, but was rejected by the people, especially the regions that is embattled with the conflict, with the believe that establishing a grazing field for cows will create opportunities for the herders to take over their land .
The Proposed settlements according to the federal government will house herders and animal farmers in order to do away with the crisis .

The government also planned to change the orientation of herders by stopping them from wondering in the bush which has endangered the lives of cows due to attack by wild animals as well as infected by deadly disease.
Check revealed that majority of the cows are facing horrible conditions as they keep moving from one location to the other in search of grasses and foods.
Some will be tempted to consume fumigated grasses and other poisonous crops which kills them instantly .
The attempt to reserved them in a settlements should be a welcome development as that will improve their welfare and as well reduce the conflict raising from their invading crops farms.

Pitiable Conditions Of Big Cats In Nigerian Wildlife Calls For  Urgent Intervention
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
By Ademu Idakwo
The horrendous conditions of big cats in the Zoo at Jos in Plateau state in Nigeria has become a source of concerns to residents of the state .
The zoo which was regarded as one of the best in Nigeria in terms of welfare of animals has become a ghost of its self

The Zoo had in its host, several numbers of healthy big cats such as lions, leopards and tigers,unfortunately most of this cats are now dead as a result of malnutritions and lack of medical attentions
Nigeria as a developing country is been faced with serious challenges, especially infrastructural decay and human development.
It is now so  glaring that non humans who have been kept under the care of government were not spared in the economic crisis.
The few ones that are left in the zoo are now a subject of discussions on the social media in Nigeria as their condition continues to deteriorate without any response from the government.
Some of the lions are now looking sick and frail due to un told hardship facing them in the zoo .
This has made a troll on the social media to throw a fun at ‘ King of the  Jungle ‘ whose existence had been reduced to that of an old dog which age has battered.

A troll which Facebook Profile reads ‘ Maazi Ogbonnaya Okoro 11’ had threw a fun at the lions in Jos zoo that ” I visited Wildlife in Jos where I saw these lions . They were tired to roar . At least I can fight two of them and win .”

Liking their deteriorating conditions of  the big cats to the humans in the country , he said’ Nigeria happens to everything, including lions in the zoo . The system has humbled the strong animals, even  the dog can fight them and win.”
This situation is the same in all Wildlife in Nigeria and the government has not done anything about them .

It is on this note that , We  in  africaanimalmedia.com , AAM is  therefore appealing to international animals welfare societies and public spiritual persons to come to the aid of this non humans and rescue them  from this in-human conditions facing them in  Jos wildlife .

The judgment which received knocks from well meaning organizations in Nigeria held that cockerels constitute nuisance to the neighborhood.
The Judge, Honourable Halima Wali directed in her judgment that the cockerel should be slaughtered by the owner, one Yusuf  within a specified  days as ruled by the court .
The case was held on the 7th march, 2023 at a Magistrate court in Kano state, Nigeria.
This according to the judge is to allow the neighborhood to have the deserving peace from the disturbances caused by the bird.
The  court’ s decision has drawn heavy backlash from well meaning Nigerians and organizations that animals should not be punished for simply carrying out their natural behavior.
This has taken us to how animals are being treated in Nigeria and Africa.
The judgment is the most bizarre in recent times .

Animal abuse has taken a new dimension in Nigeria as celebrities were  seen posing with Dog- meat pepper soup in an eatery.
It is most disturbing that while many  civilized countries are doing away with eating animal meat and adopting plant based foods,  some celebrities in Nigeria are now showing off with dog meat .
It is not a civility but an act of cruelty for man to be killing companions and wild animals who were made to be part of our ecosystem.

A video was going round on the social media platforms recently  introducing an Influencer, Enioluwa to some varieties of indigenous delicacies that include dog meat Sauce by the Super Chef as part of what she sells in her restaurant.
The Super Chef is from Akwa Ibom State where eating dog meat was never a taboo,  but the act must not be elevated to an intolerable situation as dogs deserve to live like we humans .
Though lovers all over the country have troupes to the social media platforms to condemned the super chef for breeding dogs for food restaurants business.

Disturbed by growing calls by some health consultants and professionals on the need for people to adopt plant- based meat  in every home , in order to reduce the occurrences of terminal diseases in Nigeria, Africa Animal Media, AAM   had an interview with the proprietor of Plantbased Healthcare Limited, a company based in Abuja, Nigeria, Mr. Dara Abraham, seeks his opinions on what the people stand to gain from consuming the plant-based meat .
Dara is a media delight as he spoke eloquently like authority on the product and its nutritious factors for human’s body.Our team, led by Ademu Idakwo, had an encounter with him .
Excerpt :
Who is Dara Abraham?
Dara Abraham is  a Certified Holistic Health Consultant, majoring in disease prevention and reverse of Chronic health challenges.
The  Proprietor of Plantbased Healthcare Limited. We are into manufacturing of plant-based foods .
Why plant- based meat ?

Plant-based meat is the Original protein while animal Meat is just a byproduct of protein. Animal Meat is the cause of most cancers, Lupus, diabetes, high blood pressure and other chronic diseases that are killing many people today .
What is your call to the people consuming animal meat ?

I would like to appeal to them  that if people need to live a  long, fulfilling life on earth without struggling with health problems, they should take out animal Meat from their diet, because it is poisonous as it has no nutritional benefits for our body . It is just a by-product.
This plant based  Meat is alien to Nigerians, what informed your decision to introduce it into the country ?

Plant-based Meals is not alien to Nigerians, in fact it’s now that Nigerians go for animal meat for more than years. Our people didn’t indulge so much in the consumption of meat in  those days but now people are consuming so seriously because of the so-called protein needed for the body by nutritionists and it is very wrong .
Where do we see you in the next two years with this product?

Our company is growing exponentially, as people have failed to get healed with the orthodox medicine, they’re now becoming aware of the need for a change of lifestyle and plant-based nutrition. Group Raises Concern Over Pollution Of The River Niger By Bio- Tech Company
Decries killings of aquatic species
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

Environment Experts under the aegis of Concern For Aquatic (CFA) in Abuja, Federal Capital Territory, (FCT ) have raised the alarm over alleged pollution of the River Niger by Unicane Nigeria Limited, a cassava processing plant located at Jamata in Kogi State .
According to the organisation, thecassavaplant has been discharging its waste into the river, resulting in a foul and offensive smell that is affecting aquatic life in the river.
The group National Coordinator, Comrade Arome Abimaje said the residents have reported that they have been seeing dead fish floating in the river as a result of the pollution.
The group expressed their dismay and called for an investigation into the matter.
The group therefore demanded to know who approved the citing of the plant at the Rivers’ bank, as well as how the Environmental Impact Assessment (EIA), was carried out.
The environmental experts, therefore condemned the dumping of Cassava wastes in the Rivers Niger.
It also raised concerns about the health hazards faced by people living downstream who rely on the river as their only source of drinking water.
They disclosed that the river is a source of livelihood for hundreds of people and natural habitat for millions of living things.

The group, therefore, called on the Kogi State government and relevant agencies responsible for environmental protection and regulation to investigate the matter and take appropriate action against Unicane Bio
Africa Animal Mediachecks revealed that the water flowing at the river- bank where the plant was cited turned to conplete black due to the dumping of waste from the factory .
Many aquatic species in the area are dead while others have relocated to another location that is fairly better for habitation on river .
Stories by Ademu Usman Idakwo, Abuja.

Why Birds Need To Be Free From Caging
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
Bird cagingis a form of building a sanctuary or chicken run to keep the birds under stringent control that tends to restrict their movements to a particular place or cubicles.

In Nigeria, many poultry farmers are into bird caging to protect them from destroying other valuable things at home as well as disallowing them from flying out of the house or getting themselves injured.
Whatever the reason could be,keeping the birds in captivity is like a deathsentenceonthem,as they deserve the freedom to move freely unhindered in the farm or houses .
Lack of physical or phycological space for Hen can result in higher metabolic disorder.
Lack of nesting creates acute frustration for the birds any time they are laying eggs.
Dust bathing is one of the physical characteristics that enhances their good health.

Anthrax Out Break Kills Farmed Animals In Nigeria
Government to embark on vaccines
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
Confirming the reports, theNigerian Governmentsaid plans were underway to undertake a nationwide vaccination of cattle, sheep and goats following the confirmed case of anthrax.
The Nigeria outbreak comes weeks after the government alerted Nigerians to the outbreak of the deadly disease in some neighbouring countries within the West African sub-region.
The government, in June, stated that the disease was spreading from an African countriy , Northern Ghana, bordering Burkina Faso and Togo.
Nigeria’s Government advises citizens to desist from the consumption of cow hides, smoked meat and bush meat.
Anthrax is said to have been caused by the spore-forming bacterium, Bacillus anthracis, which primarily affects animals, such as cattle, sheep, and goats.
The disease can be contracted by humans who come in direct contact with infected animals or contaminated animal products, such as meat, wool, or hides.
Anthrax may be contracted through the inhalation of spores, while cutaneous anthrax can result from contact with contaminated materials or through open wounds.
Residents of the affected state are at risk of being contacted by the disease, if not well-curtailed by federal and state officials.
Wilfred John reports for Africa Animal Media, AMM

https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

In its bid to educate the public about illegal wildlife trade and other conservative issues, Wild Africa Fund has launched a wildlife TV series in collaboration with several radio and Television Channels in Nigeria.
Wildlifeare entities regarded as not worthy of care, especially their well-being by society, even though they are part of the creation.
However, if humans can be treated with kindness and respect, why do we choose to ignore non-humans, who also deserve moral concerns as living things
People are happily practising direct cruelty and violence on wildlife.
If we can do away with all forms of bigotries like extreme racism, slavery, sexism and other moral problems in the past, what stops us from putting an end to cruelty to animals
Animal cruelty is a moral problem of our time and we must try to solve it.
It may sound funny to hear this, but slavery and other moral problems in the past were practised by the highly placed in society because it was seen as the norm in the past.
Many organisations have taken the bull by the horns to fight for animal rights and welfare.
The first of its kind in Nigeria is the Wild Africa Fund.

Wild Africa Fund, a vibrant new non-profit founded by Peter and Corie Knight is offering a free to air documentaries, short films, videos, animations and public service announcements on Television, and radio to reach out to a large audience in a bid to change attitudes and perceptions about wild animals in the society.
According to the founders, they aimed to be the leading wildlife and environmental Communicator in Africa.
They are educating, informing and driving awareness with the programmes on most Radio, Television and Social media channels in Nigeria to support Africa’s natural heritage.

Millions Of Fish Dies In Gambia From Chemical Pollution
Amnesty Raises Alarm on humans Safety
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

Gambia is one of theAfrican countrieswhere fish are being harvested from the Rivers by foreign industrial trawlers and fishmeal industries, leading to the death of millions of aquatic creatures in the Rivers.
Investigations in Gambia by our correspondent revealed a high decline in fish population in Rivers in the Gambia due to environmental degradations.
The fishmeal companies are using chemicals to harvest the fish; making them pass through excruciating pains before dying.
It is not only fishes that are victims of this act, but other aquatic creatures such as tortoises, reptiles and sea- mammals are being killed by the chemical pollution.

Pained by the attendant effect of these nefarious activities against human livelihood, a Human Rights organisation, Amnesty International, is mobilizing thousands of online petitions to the President of Gambia, Adama Barrow to put a stop to the harmful practices, which it says will exacerbate food insecurity in the country.
The organisation on World Food Day said ”Overfishingby foreign industrial trawlers and fishmeal factories threatens access to marine resources, exacerbating the risk of food insecurity for residents.
This crisis affects not only families but also local businesses, both struggling with fish scarcity and rising prices.

Did you know that fishmeal factories, like the ones that operate in Gambia, need 4.5kg of fish to produce just 1kg of fishmeal powder? This reduces the availability of fish for the communities and violates the basic human right to food.”

Amnesty has taken the bold step to fight for human Safety.However, the petition has shown that millions of fish are being killed in a month or more to satisfy the business urges of fishmeal companies to make a profit at the expense of the aquatic creatures.Who now fights for aquatic rights?

The Suffering Of Cattle In Nigeria Market
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
By Ademu Usman Idakwo

Cattle are not left out of the ill-treatment of farmed animals in Nigeria.The herdsmen in Nigeria  nurse cattle like their biological children and do everything possible to protect them from any harm of whatever form.
Aside from vaccinations, the herdsmen give them local herbs to make them healthy and to become very productive.
However, cattle suffered at the point of transportation from the farm to the market.

For instance, theCattlewill be conveyed in a truck-lorry from Katsina to Enugu State, a journey of 728 kilometres of about 15 hours 23 mins without being properly fed or spaced to create a healthy allowance for them.

They will be overcrowded, distressed and exhausted as well as dehydrated then some will eventually die.If any of them died in the course of the journey, the body would be sold to the mai-suya,the seller of beef kebabs in Hausato graciously turn it into slices of beef for consumption.
Those who survive the hardship may not be lucky at the place of disembarking from the truck.

Some will hit the ground from the truck with serious shock and fractures to the legs.Speaking in this regard, a Cattle Ranch worker, Ibrahim Aboki, who lives in Akwanga in Nasarawa State, condemned the unhealthy treatment of the cattle by the traders.
He suggested that the cattle should be given healthy treatment from the point of sale to the market.
” A very easy thing to be done is to get an inclined plane, such as a large and strong sloppy plank so that the animal can disembark to the ground to save them from fracture.
” If possible one can erect a concrete platform where the base of the Truck can rest on to make it easy for the cattle to come down from the market. “ he stated

On the transportation, the ranch worker advised that before leaving the farm, food and water should be provided in every truck for the animal to feed on, given the distance of the journey to be covered.
He said they should avoid overcrowding in a truck to create spaces for them to move unhindered to where they can feed themselves in the truck.

Breeding the Existential Risk with Artificial Intelligence
The need to support AI governance
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
By Ademu Usman Idakwo

Artificial intelligence, AI is the effort to create a computer capable of Intelligent behaviours.It is a broad term used to refer to everything from Siri to IBM’s Watson to powerful technologies we are yet toinvent.

It is believed that we don’t have a General AI yet but Narrow Artificial Intelligence, which determines what we see in a Google search or our Facebook news feed.It composes music and writes articles at a glance. It read as if a human being wrote them.They play game strategy. They are being developed to improve drone targeting and detect missiles.
One would ask,” Is it possible to make a computer as smart as a person?The answer may be yes. Though the current Artificial Intelligence, AI is not that smart.

But what of Deep Learning machines? It can do some astonishing things, like beating games, we thought humans might never win.Invent compelling and realistic photographs, and solve open problems in molecular biology.
Deep Learn is also a self-driving car, though still in a near-perfect condition despite the billions that have been invested into making it a reality.

Is Artificial Intelligence, a threat to human Existence? The answer is yes because it can act unpredictably as the system might have bugs or intended behaviour or the behaviours humans don’t understand.
Stephen Hawking said ” The development of full artificial intelligence could spell the end of the human race.
Elon Musk claims also follows the same direction that “AI is humanity’s biggest existential threat . ”

These worries were coming out of an evidence-based study that says that the advanced system of Artificial Intelligence, AI if deployed carelessly, could permanently cut off human civilization from a good future.
This is true?
Yes of course, because the idea that AI can become a danger is rooted in the fact that AI system pursue their goals, whether or not those goals are what we intended.

AI contributes to digital people with a wild ride. It blindingly fast growth every facet of human endeavours by producing output beyond what humans could meaning track making the world quickly approaching the limit of what is possible.
Is AI helpful to both humans and non-humans in daily life?

Yes, Artificial Intelligence (AI) can automate tasks, and improve efficiency and productivity in various industries. Data Analysis and Insights:AI algorithms can analyze large data quickly, providing valuable insights for decision-making like detecting diseases, and wildfire to manufacturing security gadgets.While in non-humans, AI has helped Animals over time using algorithms to study their movement patterns, which can provide important details about their behaviour, habitat use and needs of various populations and decide how to protect them.
Despite the enormous advantages of deploying Artificial Intelligence, the esses are a necessary check, because the world’s explosive growth may lead to total collapse.
That global catastrophe could cut down to a stage of affecting our existence may come from AI.
Human ingenuity in deep learning machines may prolong or shorten our lifespan.
Our forefathers worshipped the moon a few centuries back, but now we work on the moon.
The world must rise to support the call for research agenda for A. I governance that will ensure that advanced deep learning models don’t pursue dangerous goals.

Nigeria Government Urges To Prosecute Military Officer For Killing Two Elephants
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

By Ademu Usman IdakwoTheNigerian Veterinary Medical Association,NVMA has called on the Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security to commence an investigation into the brutal killing of two elephant calves in Kala Balge, a Semi-urban Community in Borno State.
The President of the association, Dr Moses Arokoyo in a statement in Abuja condemned the brutal killing ofwild animalson the 17th of December, 2023.

The association also added that it received with embarrassment and deep pain, another report of the killings of two booted eagles that migrated from Europe but met their sad ends in Kebbi and Sokoto states.
On the Elephants, the NVMA said the elephants were allegedly killed by a military officer, citing a video posted on social media.
“A military personnel (wearing camouflage) was caught in the act as evident in a viral video circulating across social media platforms committing this cruelty against the young innocent wild animals.

” This inhumane act depicts the premeditated and willful termination of a harmless and defenceless creature’s life, it also infringes on the animal’s right to live, which is our duty to protect as veterinarians,” the association stated
He told the NVMA and the public that the Nigerian National Park Service is already being engaged on the issue to ensure those behind the killing of those animals are brought to book.

The statement further disclosed that the Nigerian Veterinary Medical Association, NVMA will work in unison with the Veterinary Council of Nigeria, VCN and the Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security to find a solution to the continued animal brutality, as is becoming of great concern.

He said an effort will be made to intensify awareness campaigns to save wildlife from an attack by people.“We are open to collaborations with all stakeholders to prevent the recurrence of this act and ensure a mutual coexistence between humans, wildlife and all other members of the ecosystem,” the NVMA president stated.

The Deforestation And Persistence Killing of Wild Life In Akamkpa
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
By Ademu Usman Idakwo

In Nigeria, Cross River State has been reported to have at least 70 per cent of the remaining forest with the largest mangrove ecosystem.The biodiversity has made those forests to be home to many wild animals.
The escalatingdeforestationby the people for extraction of woods for logging and other domestic uses has exposed the animals to harm as the habitats were being destroyed.
The biodiversity habitat destruction has led to animals running into the villages and becoming prey to the villagers who kill and maim them at will for consumption or sale.
A case in point was a village in Akamkpa Local Government Area of the state where people gathered aroundSix Porcuppinesthat strayed into the town in broad daylight and killed them.
This beautiful animals were surrounded by villagers who were at a local beer parlour on sighting the porcupines running around and smatched them with stones.
What a cruel death!

According to Macmillan Okon, an indigene of the community who spoke with AFRICA ANIMAL MEDIA, said in recent times animals used to come to the town, especially when the weather is hot to stay under the big trees behind the houses for shelter.

He said “Like my daddy’s garden we have killed almost eight Grass Cutters in the last two weeks.We keep water in a big bowl for them to come and drink, then we hide behind the wall with a big stick once they come and start drinking the water we take on them .”

On why the animals were always coming to the village, Okon claimed that they mostly came to drink water because most of the ponds in the forests are now dry because of the falling of the trees that cover the water from the intensity of the sun.

The 27-year-old man further narrated that the community is also experiencing the visit of wild animals like Gorillas and big cats.“But this one, it is the hunters that used to help us by shooting  them to death. Honestly, there are some villages here where people fear going out at night because of gorillas. Some times they are seen walking on the foot path leading houses from the farms without feeling that they run into human .
Though it has gradually reduced because we engaged the services of the hunters to deal with the situation”. He stated
Okon’s narration of wild animal’s  threats is one of the consequences of disturbing their habitats.
They have no place to stay and rest; the water in the ponds in the forests is drying off as a result of exposure to the scorching sun.
No more fruits and herbs for them to eat, even though some are carnivorous they may still eat some herbs and fruits but these were plundered away by the timber contractors.
It was further revealed that the forest guards who are saddled with the responsibility of protecting the forests from being destroyed by the timber contractors are said to be corrupt.
Once they catch an offender, he or she will be free upon greasing their palms with money.

The Cross Rivers State National Park whose sole responsibility is to conserve biodiversity to sustain conservation has also turned a blind eye or may lack the needed resources to tackle the challenges in the area.But the time to act is now !!!!

Can Myths Be A Saving Grace For Non- humans In Africa
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png

It is false to believe that only humans are sentient;non-humananimals may feel and experience emotions. They have feelings because they feel pain like human beings. How do we save them from the danger of being killed or harming themselves?

Many stories revolve around ancient traditions and customs in Africa, where people worship animals as their gods, yet these same gods are foods for some other communities that kill and slaughter them for consumption.

There is a particular tribe in my place that reveres and worships the monitor lizard (the big lizard). Anyone who kills it has defiled their land and must be made to make sacrifices or be banished from the community.
There is also a town in Kebbi State, Nigeria, where people live and sleep together with snakes, whom they refer to as their blood relatives.
At the palace of their king, the snake has a place to live with its offspring, and they move freely within the palace unhindered.

As a visitor who was coming to this community for the first time, the presence could be terrifying, but you may draw solace from the aborigine, whom you will see working free around without fear of being bitten by the reptiles.
The snakes are being worshipped and honored, just as they revere the king of the community.

Any stranger who kills the snake will die or be made to pay a penalty. The snake king is always consulted for spiritual guidance; does that imply that the snake can talk or act as a mediator between the living and their ancestors?

In some communities in Kogi State, Nigeria, some clans were said to have been reincarnated  by the lion according to their myths, and such people can mysteriously turn to the big cat when the need arises.
Do we call it Africa Magic?
This particular tribe was known to be warriors in dated histories who usually fought against external aggression.
The recent issue was a middle-aged man who killed a monkey in Akwa, Anambra State, against the tradition of the kingdom.

He was fined and left off the hook because he outsmarted the tradition by going to confess openly on social media to having committed a sacrilege against the norms and customs of the land. The Natives forgave him and cautioned him never to repeat such a thing again.
Now, can customs and traditions be used to save nonhumans from horrendous conditions in Africa?

Nigeria Proposes Law To Protect WIld Life
https://africaanimalmedia.com/wp-content/themes/assets/../assets/img/jeg-empty.png
By Ademu Usman Idakwo

A Federal lawmaker , representing Kwande/ Ushongo Federal Constituency in the House of Representatives in Nigeria from Benue State, Hon. Terseer Ugbor,  has decried the bad rating of Nigeria as a global center  forwildlifetrafficking in the recent years.
Ugbor ,  Deputy Chairman, House Committee on Environment has lamented the illegal activities of poachers and smugglers in Nigeria, even as he called for action to stop the trend.

The federal lawmaker said  addressing these issues requires multifaceted approach, stricter enforcement, community engagement, and international cooperation which will in turn play crucial role in bringing this to an end.
He stated this in Abuja at  the National Assembly Complex  in a one day policy dialogue on “The Endangered Species Conservation and Protection Bill 2024″.
The lawmaker  who sponsored the bill, said the activities of poachers portend grave dangers to the nation’s economy.

The lawmaker said “Nigeria has emerged with the unenviable status as a global hub for wildlife trafficking in recent years, and continues to be considered as one. Nigeria must therefore act quickly and work to reverse this negative status and threat to our beautiful country and the world.

“The passage of this legislation will mark a major milestone for global conservation efforts and Nigeria’s international image. The passage of this bill will also advance the legislative agenda of the 10th House of Representatives for Nigeria’s environmental sustainability.”

He equally  noted that, the proposed legislation is “Aimed to address threats to biodiversity in Nigeria and across Africa by providing a consistent and strong legal framework to put an end to wildlife trafficking.

He stressed thatbiodiversityis threatened by the actions of wildlife criminals even as he noted that insecurity and zoonotic diseases such as COVID-19 have been traced to vices associated with wildlife criminality.

The Lawmaker further commended the Environmental Investigation Agency,Africa Nature Investors Foundation, and Wild Africa Fund for their input in the bill even as he acknowledged the donations of the UK Illegal Wildlife Trade Challenge Fund, the US State Department Bureau of International Narcotics and LawEnforcement Affairs, as well as the Pangolin Conservation Fund.

By Ademu Usman Idakwo
In a bid to raise awareness about the benefits of veganism, animal rights and sustainable living, a non governmental organization,NGO, Luv4all inUgandahas announced a 3-day vegan festival.
The festival which is slated from December 1 to 3rd at Jinja District will feature workshops on veganism, animal rights and sustainable living.
The founder of Luv4all , Musisi Mike who in a press statement made available to AFRICA ANIMAL MEDIA, AAM said a divergent range of vegan food stalls and restaurants will be available.
The statement further stated that yoga and wellness classes will also be featured prominently including music and entertainment.
“ We will also have a marketplace featuring eco-friendly products and practice . “ He disclosed.
Mike also explained that the impact of the festival is to raise awareness about the benefits of veganism, and plant based food.

“ We are excited to announce that slots are available for international speakers to share their expertise and experiences with our audience. Additionally, we welcome individuals, organizations, and charities who share our vision to sponsor our event and support our mission.

“At Luv4all:Uganda, we believe in the power of compassion and sustainability. Our goal is to create a platform where individuals can come together, learn, and grow. Join us for a fun-filled weekend of veganism, sustainability, and community building!”, the founder stated .
